sentences.sContent: She rocked the cradle to quieten the child.
sentences.sCn: 她摇动摇篮，让宝宝安静下来。

sentences.sContent: ...university serves as the cradle of academic researchers in different areas...

synos.tran: 摇篮；发源地；发祥地；[建][医]支船架
抚育；把...搁在支架上；把...放在摇篮内

phrases.pCn: 在摇篮里；在婴儿时期；初期
一生（等于from the cradle to the grave）
[美俚]劫摇篮；老牛吃嫩草；与比自己年轻地多的异性约会

remMethod.val: 烛(candle)光摇曳， 母亲看着摇篮(cradle)里熟睡的婴儿

trans.tranOther: a small bed for a baby, especially one that moves gently from side to side
to hold something gently, as if to protect it
